intro: Wahlenbergia gracilis f. multicaulis, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. This variety is distinguished by its multiple stems, which contribute to its unique appearance and ecological adaptability.
